site_name: Kingston Mansions 145-147 Clapham RoadLondonSW9 0HP
description: Located in rear garden:(0A39) Catalpa bignonioides - Multi stemmed. Remove 2x smaller stems from base that rub and merge with main stem structure to create a healthy single stem tree. Reshape canopy by pruning over extended branches by no more than 1m to balance crown.(0A3A) Salix sp. - Remove stem that has heavy lean over footpath and reduce remaining crown by 1m to balance and create a healthy crown shape.(0A3B) Aesculus hippocastanum - Reshape crown by pruning over extended branches by no more than 1m to appropriate pruning points to balance canopy.(0A3C) Sambucus nigra - Fell to ground level due to heavily Ivy congested crown and encroachment issues.Front of property:(0A3D) Prunus sp. - Mature tree with poor crown formation and severe lean due to suppression. Reduce crown by 3m to relieve heavy lean and weight distribution to closest appropriate growth point, and crown lift to 2m from ground level to clear headroom.(0A3E) Prunus sp. x2 - Crown lift to 2m from ground level to clear headroom.(0A3F) Lime x2 - Remove sucker growth from base and stem to 3m from ground level. (0A3G) Lime - Lift crown to 3m from ground level and prune branches around streetlamp to appropriate growth points giving 1m clearance.(0A3H) Prunus sp. - Prune lateral growth towards footpath back to boundary to clear for pedestrians.See attached plan for tree specifications.
